reviews.text: I recently visited the Hotel Camelia and found it to be very nice and a great value. The rooms were very clean and although not huge, very comfortable ... exactly as pictured on Venere.com. Breakfast was basic but okay and the staff was very attentive. It has a very convenient location, approximately 4 blocks from Termini Station and about a 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. Originally, I contacted the hotel directly for rates but found the rates on Venere.com to be much better. Overall, this hotel offers an excellent value as a solid 3 star property and I would definitely stay here again.

reviews.text: Conveniently located near the Termini station, but a bit off the main city center. However, you need 20-25 minutes to reach Trevi or Spanish steps. Rooms are very nice, comfortable, bathroom great, AC works all the times, free wi-fi in the rooms. Reception staff very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast typically Italian, excellent coffee and one of best juices I have tried. I would recommend if you need to be neat train station (convenient to reach Fuimicino airport from there) so you do not have to carry your luggage a long way or to pay taxis.
reviews.title: Very satisfied

reviews.text: Hotel Camelia is a 5-10 min safe walk from termini train station therefore ideal for airport transfer buses, metro, tour buses etc. Very safe area with good choice of restaurants/bars within 5-10 min walk. Small restaurant literally next door to hotel open evenings from 5pm only but food very enjoyable and reasonable. Fairly large supermarket at one end of street good for stocking up as able to store items in hotel room mini bar. Initial contact with hotel via email and they were most helpful. On arrival a member of grou[p was unwell and reception staff with very nice and helped us any way they could. I travelled as 3 friends and were given 1 single room and 2 doubles for single use. Single room was small but spotlessley clean as was whole hotel. Doubles were extremely spacious and all equiped with mini bar, free safe, ample storage, tv, bath/shower, toiletries. For 3* in Rome very good. Only slight issue was single room toilet would not flush but maid got it working and showed us this but next day wouldn't work again! Breakfast fairly simple continental with cereals, fruit, yoghurts, bread/rolls, juice/tea/coffee, pastries and processed cheeses (no meats) but very nice and well stocked all morning (7am-10am). Hotel has free internet access, free tea/coffee all day in reception, lift but no bar and no problem to leave suitcases on check in/out day. Also small toilet area used to get changed in before late transfer back to airport. Altogether very good hotel, pleasant area, helpful staff and spotless! Very good rates available through bookassist.com (approx 60/65 euro per room per night) with small deposit payable on booking and balance direct to hotel at end of stay. Also good late deals on hotels own website. Rome is my favourite city and am really pleased to have found Hotel Camelia as having stayed in quite a few 3* tourist hotels in Rome before I will definately stay here again!
reviews.title: fantastic hotel - i will go back!

reviews.text: Me and my friend were worried beacause we got such a good price and wondered if there must be something not right. We knew beacause it was near the train station the location might be a bit rough.. However, on arrival at the hotel, I was impressed, the receptionist was friendly and rooms were clean. Some might say the rooms were small but I had no complaints as we were out and about all the time. Local restaurants were cheap and for something more fancy a trip on the metro wasnt far away. It was easy enough to visit all the major sights as the metro was 5mins away. Breakfast was standard and every morning I availed of it. There was a little tea and coffee machine was great to have. All in all I was pleasantly surprised
reviews.title: Great price , great service and cant say a bad thing about our stay here

reviews.text: I highly recommend hotel Camelia. A nice small hotel, excellent service, clean, nice rooms ( we even get a nicer room than before this time). The people at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Still the same people as two years a go when we first stay at this hotel. One morning, we had to go for a day tour very early, and one of them prepared us 2 bags of breakfast (croissant, cookies, orange juice, omelette and boiled egg) so that we won't miss our breakfast. We didn't even ask! :) The location is superb. Close to supermarket, restaurants and 10 minutes walk to Termini station. Would love to stay again for our next trip to Rome.
reviews.title: Came back for the second time, and still the best

reviews.text: Id recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good base to see the main sites of rome. Placed in between 3 stops on the metro (lines A and B), one of which is the main Termini Station, and maybe a 20 minute walk to the trevi fountain and the pantehon. The rooms arent huge but are more than sufficient, with air con and safe (both of which are free). The breakfast is excellent with Coffee and Juices, Bread, cheeses and Eggs, plus cereals and cakes, and the free internet setup is also brilliant.
reviews.title: Perfect for a Mini Break
